docs.snippet: SEERS are once again brooding over Doomsday, that time of cosmic cataclysm which will bring the world to an end and may come with a bang or a whimper. Its approach has most recently been predicted by a physicist at the University of Illinois, Dr. ...
docs.lead_paragraph: SEERS are once again brooding over Doomsday, that time of cosmic cataclysm which will bring the world to an end and may come with a bang or a whimper. Its approach has most recently been predicted by a physicist at the University of Illinois, Dr. Heinz von Foerster, who calculates that on or about Friday, Nov. 13, 2026, the world's exploding population will become so dense that we'll all be squeezed to death.

headline.main: Doom's Many Voices; Predicting the world's end is a rite that goes back almost to its beginning.

docs.snippet: TRENTON, Dec. 21 -- The New Jersey Legislature today approved and sent to Gov. Alfred E. Driscoll for signature a bill designed to assure this state of enough drinking water for the next fifty years....
docs.lead_paragraph: TRENTON, Dec. 21 -- The New Jersey Legislature today approved and sent to Gov. Alfred E. Driscoll for signature a bill designed to assure this state of enough drinking water for the next fifty years.

headline.main: WATER SUPPLY BILL GOES TO DRISCOLL; Legislature Acts to Fill Needs for Next 50 Years -- Limit on Race Tracks Voted

docs.lead_paragraph: Adolph Hitler in a message to President Roosevelt today upon the Texas disaster said: "For the terrible New London catastrophe costing so many young lives I convey to Your Excellency my sincere condolence as well as that of the German people.

headline.main: HITLER SENDS SYMPATHY; Berlin Newspaper Says All Germany Shares Sorrow Over Disaster

docs.abstract: Outlines health program for Ohio-Miss Valleys flood victims

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: With every government agency working in harmony and the War Department ready to evacuate 500,000 persons between Cairo and New Orleans, if this should be necessary, the President's special flood relief committee prepared to leave tomorrow for Memphis, from which point northward they will make a complete survey of the entire situation.

headline.main: PRESIDENT MEETS FLOOD COMMITTEE; Group Led by Hopkins Will Leave Today for Memphis to Survey Ohio Valley

docs.snippet: BISMARCK, N.D., June 20. -- Citizens gathered in mass meetings for a united front in the drought emergency heard Governor Walter Welford relay the assurance of President Roosevelt today that the State would receive all possible support....
docs.lead_paragraph: BISMARCK, N.D., June 20. -- Citizens gathered in mass meetings for a united front in the drought emergency heard Governor Walter Welford relay the assurance of President Roosevelt today that the State would receive all possible support.
